meanings.definition: A person or thing differing from all other members of a particular group or set.
meanings.sent1: In the classroom, Sarah was the outlier because she was the only one wearing a red hat.
meanings.sent2: The black sheep of the family was considered the outlier due to his unconventional lifestyle.
meanings.sent3: At the zoo, the penguin was the outlier among the birds because it couldn't fly.
meanings.sent4: Among the sea of blue cars, the bright pink one stood out like an outlier.
meanings.sent5: The lone tree in the middle of the desert was a striking outlier in the barren landscape.

meanings.definition: A data point that is significantly different from other data points in a statistical analysis.
meanings.sent1: The temperature reading of 100 degrees was an outlier in the dataset of mild spring days.
meanings.sent2: The outlier in the survey results skewed the overall average of responses.
meanings.sent3: The outlier data point was like a rebel in the midst of conformity.
meanings.sent4: The outlier value was like a bright red flag waving in a sea of neutral colors.
meanings.sent5: The outlier data point was so extreme that it was impossible to ignore in the analysis.
